trans-unit.source: SQLite databases
trans-unit.target: SQLite databases

trans-unit.source: SQLite is a server-less, embedded database engine.
trans-unit.target: SQLite is a server-less, embedded database engine.

trans-unit.source: This article explains how to use the SQLite library included in the SDK, package your own SQLite library in a Universal Windows app, or build it from the source.
trans-unit.target: This article explains how to use the SQLite library included in the SDK, package your own SQLite library in a Universal Windows app, or build it from the source.

trans-unit.source: SQLite databases
trans-unit.target: SQLite databases

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: SQLite is a server-less, embedded database engine.
trans-unit.target: SQLite is a server-less, embedded database engine.

trans-unit.source: This article explains how to use the SQLite library included in the SDK, package your own SQLite library in a Universal Windows app, or build it from the source.
trans-unit.target: This article explains how to use the SQLite library included in the SDK, package your own SQLite library in a Universal Windows app, or build it from the source.

trans-unit.source: What SQLite is and when to use it
trans-unit.target: What SQLite is and when to use it

trans-unit.source: SQLite is an open source, embedded, server-less database.
trans-unit.target: SQLite is an open source, embedded, server-less database.

trans-unit.source: Over the years it has emerged as the dominant device side technology for data storage on many platforms and devices.
trans-unit.target: Over the years it has emerged as the dominant device side technology for data storage on many platforms and devices.

trans-unit.source: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) supports and recommends SQLite for local storage across all Windows 10 device families.
trans-unit.target: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) supports and recommends SQLite for local storage across all Windows 10 device families.

trans-unit.source: SQLite is best suited for phone apps, embedded applications for Windows 10 IoT Core (IoT Core), and as a cache for enterprise relations database server (RDBS) data.
trans-unit.target: SQLite is best suited for phone apps, embedded applications for Windows 10 IoT Core (IoT Core), and as a cache for enterprise relations database server (RDBS) data.

trans-unit.source: It will satisfy most local data access needs unless they entail heavy concurrent writes, or a big data scale—scenarios unlikely for most apps.
trans-unit.target: It will satisfy most local data access needs unless they entail heavy concurrent writes, or a big data scale—scenarios unlikely for most apps.

trans-unit.source: In media playback and gaming applications, SQLite can also be used as a file format to store catalogues or other assets, such as levels of a game, that can be downloaded as-is from a web server.
trans-unit.target: In media playback and gaming applications, SQLite can also be used as a file format to store catalogues or other assets, such as levels of a game, that can be downloaded as-is from a web server.

trans-unit.source: Adding SQLite to a UWP app project
trans-unit.target: Adding SQLite to a UWP app project

trans-unit.source: There are three ways of adding SQLite to a UWP project.
trans-unit.target: There are three ways of adding SQLite to a UWP project.

trans-unit.source: Using the SDK SQLite
trans-unit.target: Using the SDK SQLite

trans-unit.source: Including SQLite in the App Package
trans-unit.target: Including SQLite in the App Package

trans-unit.source: Building SQLite from source in Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Building SQLite from source in Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: Using the SDK SQLite
trans-unit.target: Using the SDK SQLite

trans-unit.source: You may wish to use the SQLite library included in the UWP SDK to reduce the size of your application package, and rely on the platform to update the library periodically.
trans-unit.target: You may wish to use the SQLite library included in the UWP SDK to reduce the size of your application package, and rely on the platform to update the library periodically.

trans-unit.source: Using the SDK SQLite might also lead to performance advantages such as faster launch times given the SQLite library is highly likely to already be loaded in memory for use by system components.
trans-unit.target: Using the SDK SQLite might also lead to performance advantages such as faster launch times given the SQLite library is highly likely to already be loaded in memory for use by system components.

trans-unit.source: To reference the SDK SQLite, include the following header in your project.
trans-unit.target: To reference the SDK SQLite, include the following header in your project.

trans-unit.source: The header also contains the version of SQLite supported in the platform.
trans-unit.target: The header also contains the version of SQLite supported in the platform.

trans-unit.source: Configure the project to link to winsqlite3.lib.
trans-unit.target: Configure the project to link to winsqlite3.lib.

trans-unit.source: In **Solution Explorer**, right-click your project and select **Properties** > **Linker** > **Input**, then add winsqlite3.lib to **Additional Dependencies**.
trans-unit.target: In **Solution Explorer**, right-click your project and select **Properties** > **Linker** > **Input**, then add winsqlite3.lib to **Additional Dependencies**.

trans-unit.source: 2. Including SQLite in the App Package
trans-unit.target: 2. Including SQLite in the App Package

trans-unit.source: Sometimes, you might wish to package your own library instead of using the SDK version, for example, you might wish to use a particular version of it in your cross-platform clients that is different from the version of SQLite included in the SDK.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes, you might wish to package your own library instead of using the SDK version, for example, you might wish to use a particular version of it in your cross-platform clients that is different from the version of SQLite included in the SDK.

trans-unit.source: Install the SQLite library on the Universal Windows Platform Visual Studio extension available from SQLite.org, or through the Extensions and Updates tool.
trans-unit.target: Install the SQLite library on the Universal Windows Platform Visual Studio extension available from SQLite.org, or through the Extensions and Updates tool.

trans-unit.source: Extensions and Updates screen
trans-unit.target: Extensions and Updates screen

trans-unit.source: Once the extension is installed, reference the following header file in your code.
trans-unit.target: Once the extension is installed, reference the following header file in your code.

trans-unit.source: 3. Building SQLite from source in Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: 3. Building SQLite from source in Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: Sometimes you might wish to compile your own SQLite binary to use [various compiler options](http://www.sqlite.org/compile.html) to reduce the file size, performance tune the library, or tailor the feature set to your application.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes you might wish to compile your own SQLite binary to use [various compiler options](http://www.sqlite.org/compile.html) to reduce the file size, performance tune the library, or tailor the feature set to your application.

trans-unit.source: SQLite provides options for platform configuration, setting default parameter values, setting size limits, controlling operating characteristics, enabling features normally turned off, disabling features normally turned on, omitting features, enabling analysis and debugging, and managing memory allocation behavior on Windows.
trans-unit.target: SQLite provides options for platform configuration, setting default parameter values, setting size limits, controlling operating characteristics, enabling features normally turned off, disabling features normally turned on, omitting features, enabling analysis and debugging, and managing memory allocation behavior on Windows.

trans-unit.source: Adding source to a Visual Studio project
trans-unit.target: Adding source to a Visual Studio project

trans-unit.source: The SQLite source code is available for download at the [SQLite.org download page](https://www.sqlite.org/download.html).
trans-unit.target: The SQLite source code is available for download at the [SQLite.org download page](https://www.sqlite.org/download.html).

trans-unit.source: Add this file to the Visual Studio project of the application you wish to use SQLite in.
trans-unit.target: Add this file to the Visual Studio project of the application you wish to use SQLite in.

trans-unit.source: Configure Preprocessors
trans-unit.target: Configure Preprocessors

trans-unit.source: Always use SQLITE\_OS\_WINRT and SQLITE\_API=\_\_declspec(dllexport) in addition to any other [compile time options](http://www.sqlite.org/compile.html).
trans-unit.target: Always use SQLITE\_OS\_WINRT and SQLITE\_API=\_\_declspec(dllexport) in addition to any other [compile time options](http://www.sqlite.org/compile.html).

trans-unit.source: SQLite Property Pages screen
trans-unit.target: SQLite Property Pages screen

trans-unit.source: Managing a SQLite Database
trans-unit.target: Managing a SQLite Database

trans-unit.source: SQLite databases can be created, updated, and deleted with the SQLite C APIs.
trans-unit.target: SQLite databases can be created, updated, and deleted with the SQLite C APIs.

trans-unit.source: Details of the SQLite C API can be found at the SQLite.org [Introduction To The SQLite C/C++ Interface](http://www.sqlite.org/cintro.html) page.
trans-unit.target: Details of the SQLite C API can be found at the SQLite.org [Introduction To The SQLite C/C++ Interface](http://www.sqlite.org/cintro.html) page.

trans-unit.source: To gain sound understanding of how SQLite works, work backwards from the main task of the SQL database which is to evaluate SQL statements.
trans-unit.target: To gain sound understanding of how SQLite works, work backwards from the main task of the SQL database which is to evaluate SQL statements.

trans-unit.source: There are two objects to keep in mind:
trans-unit.target: There are two objects to keep in mind:

trans-unit.source: The database connection handle
trans-unit.target: The database connection handle

trans-unit.source: The prepared statement object
trans-unit.target: The prepared statement object

trans-unit.source: There are six interfaces to perform database operations on these objects:
trans-unit.target: There are six interfaces to perform database operations on these objects:

trans-unit.source: sqlite3\_open()
trans-unit.target: sqlite3\_open()

trans-unit.source: sqlite3\_prepare()
trans-unit.target: sqlite3\_prepare()

trans-unit.source: sqlite3\_step()
trans-unit.target: sqlite3\_step()

trans-unit.source: sqlite3\_column()
trans-unit.target: sqlite3\_column()

trans-unit.source: sqlite3\_finalize()
trans-unit.target: sqlite3\_finalize()

trans-unit.source: sqlite3\_close()
trans-unit.target: sqlite3\_close()
